On Mon, Mar 26, 2018 at 10:50 PM AEDT, Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org> wrote:

Hi Heath,

Unfortunately the edit event function is still not working. I’ve done the same process again of adding a test event and had the same result – when I clicked on the link in the email to edit the submitted event, all fields were displayed as blank.

Please can you fix this immediately and ensure the error is fixed permanently?

I’ve also found another error on the Arabic main research profiles page. There is a big white space on the right-hand side so most of the profiles aren’t visible or accessible to click on. Please can you fix this?

We’re getting close to the campaign period now and I would really appreciate it if you could double-check that there are no other glitches across the site, as this has happened a few times now.

From my end, I’m awaiting the event page and still awaiting that one final profile photo. I’ll send these when ready.

I will send you a separate email regarding the animation.

Thanks very much.

Best wishes,
Natasha

Natasha Smith

Subject: Re: Error: event edit function

Hi Natasha,

Apologies, we found the error, the token links were a little too long for the browser, hence why you were receiving the blank fields.

Regarding the languages, yes update this with the different languages if you send the translations through.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU

E. heath@wolfiq.com.au | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271

On 23 Mar 2018, at 4:33 am, Natasha Smith <natasha@msif.org> wrote:

Hi Heath,

I just added a test event using my personal email address to test the event edit function that you added recently. However, the link in the email just takes me to the blank “Submit your event” page, with none of the event information displayed for me to edit. I’ve tried this both on the computer and on my phone – same result. (I’ve since made the test event I added private, so it won’t be displayed publicly).

Please can you fix this urgently?

Also, is all of the text related to this event edit function (e.g. on the webpage: “Event submitted. A link has been sent where you can edit the submitted event. Thank you for submitting your event!” and the content of the follow-up email) only displayed in English, or is it also available in the other languages?

Best wishes,
Natasha
